conclusion: A drives in from the group of blocks on the right.
Observe the direction of the arrow, which indicates the path that A will take.
Identify the blocks that are in the path of A. In this case, the blue block and the orange block are in the path.
Consider the power of A, which is represented by the size and speed of the car.
A is a small car, so it will not have enough power to move the blocks out of its way.
Consider the collision and deflection effects.
When A collides with the blue block, it will likely be deflected slightly to the right.
This deflection will cause A to then collide with the orange block.
After colliding with the orange block, A will likely come to a stop due to the force of the collision and the friction of the surface.
A will collide with the blue block and the orange block, and it will eventually stop at the point where the arrow is pointing.
